name: NPR
text: Scotland has passed a bill that has made period products such as tampons and pads free to all who need them. https://t.co/12wfStW40v

name: NPR
text: Mayor Bill de Blasio says New York City's schools will begin a phased reopening on Dec. 7 https://t.co/LuuUoUUL0g

name: NPR
text: Joe Biden has named seven women to key communications roles in his incoming White House — the first time in history that the positions will be filled entirely by women, according to the president-elect's transition team. https://t.co/tXSYjhhjpI

name: NPR
text:
The Trump campaign paid $3 million to proceed with a partial recount in two Wisconsin counties.

When it concluded, President-elect Joe Biden's winning margin had increased by 87 total votes.
https://t.co/xgKxA2fivU

name: NPR
text:
Do you belieeeeeve in life after eight years alone? 

Kaavan the elephant has been by himself at the Islamabad Zoo since his partner died of gangrene in 2012. He's moving to a sanctuary in Cambodia thanks to efforts by activists, including @Cher. https://t.co/7i8ZIZeUmk

name: NPR
text: Canada has blocked the distribution of certain medications outside the country in response to a U.S. plan to import drugs from Canada. President Trump promised it would lower costs and be a "game changer" for seniors. https://t.co/P9m7QSnGfB

name: NPR
text: Scores of agricultural workers were reportedly slaughtered in Nigeria's Borno state by suspected Islamist militants. https://t.co/4zJ7Mqo0Uv

name: NPR
text:
We're born with the wiring for both kindness and cruelty, so altruism is not inevitable. It's a skill and a habit that we have the power to foster.

Here are some ways parents can help their children cultivate kindness. (@nprlifekit) https://t.co/3bt5mQJ19O

name: NPR
text:
Reinvigorating the Justice Department's Civil Rights Division is a top priority for the incoming administration. The question is: Where to begin?
https://t.co/klEC9L8DVY

name: NPR
text: The metallic prism has inspired theories to its origin after its discovery in a remote location in Red Rock Country. Officials say it was removed by an "unknown party." https://t.co/RPJ12BMhKb

name: NPR
text: Sarah Fuller is the first woman to ever play in a Power 5 college football game. https://t.co/XzXiRAgOnR

name: NPR
text: Wilton Gregory has become the first Black American cardinal in the history of Catholicism. https://t.co/GKAzLcgl8H

name: NPR
text: Human passengers rode in a hyperloop train for the first time ever earlier this month. They traveled inside an enclosed tube at over 100 mph — though it could have reached much greater speeds. @hereandnow https://t.co/rOz6CpzFj0

name: NPR
text:
Many people feel they have less social support from friends and family now than before the pandemic. 

For some, their pets have played a critical role in helping to reduce depression, anxiety, isolation and loneliness, recent surveys find. https://t.co/HxUYzHznKT

name: NPR
text:
The music industry and the justice system both bet on Bobby Shmurda. In the end, the community he came from paid the biggest price.
https://t.co/ZmQWyrAcci

name: NPR
text:
Moderna has new data reinforcing that its COVID-19 vaccine is safe and effective.

The company plans to submit an application to the FDA today requesting emergency use authorization.
https://t.co/vgcspztlys

name: NPR
text:
Even as his administration is heading out the door, President Trump is trying to exclude undocumented immigrants from the decennial census. 

Today, it goes before the Supreme Court.
https://t.co/jEXj15O1oD

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden has formally announced top members of his incoming economic team.

Among them: Cecilia Rouse, who, if confirmed, will be the first Black woman to lead the Council of Economic Advisers.
https://t.co/ICLlSqamsc
